question: Some experts believe that it is better for children to begin learning a foreign language at primary schools rather than secondary school.  Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
text: It is believed by some professionals that learning a foreign language at primary school is better compared to secondary school. This trend has both merits and demerits. I believe that despite having few drawbacks, it has been beneficial in numerous ways for students.

To commence with, there are two major advantages of this notion. First and foremost, at a young age, children have a high grasping power due to which they can learn new things in a lesser time.For instance, a four-year-old boy may learn to operate mobile faster compare to a fifty-year-old lady because of the functionality of the brain. So, if children learn a new language during their primary school days, then they will take less time to learn compared to higher schooling time. Secondly, mastering a foreign language can be beneficial to many students if they plan to settle abroad for job opportunities, because they will be given privilege compare to people who are not aware of the local language. Thus, knowledge of a foreign language can be advantageous in many ways.

On the other hand, this development has few shortcomings. The primary disadvantage of this approach is that learning a new language may not be useful for those who do not wish to move to other countries. For example, if a child is learning French during his school days and later if he chooses to become an IT professional in his own country, then French would not be of any benefit to him in his career. Another drawback is that children do not possess the required decision making skill during their early school days as compared to secondary school where they can understand their field of interest. So, if they do not choose a career in the language field later, then it is a waste of time for them during primary school. Hence, learning a non-regional language in primary school might be of  less benefit.

To conclude, although there are vivid drawbacks of this given statement, its merits have clear victory over them because the benefits such as the addition of knowledge and future opportunities in a different country cannot be overlooked. Therefore, I believe that the advantages of this phenomenon outweigh its disadvantages.
